messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Settlers of Catan
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/7/03 6:29:17 AM, tjulrich@chartermi.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/7/03 6:29:17 AM, tjulrich@... writes:

<< I know some high school kids who love it and am debating whether to spend
the $38.00. I have a 9yo boy, 11yo and 14yo girls. Is it hard to learn?>>

It's a great game. It's not hard. If they like it a WHOLE lot, spring for
the expansion set, too. It is pricey, but it's the price of taking them to the
movie once, and will last for years. Probably one of the kids' lifetime (and
who will get it when they move out? You might end up buying more than one...)

Sandra

messages.subject: Settlers of Catan
messages.msgSnippet: Does anyone play Settlers of Catan?  I know some high school kids who love it and am debating whether to spend the $38.00.  I have a  9yo boy, 11yo and 14yo
messages.messageBody:
Does anyone play "Settlers of Catan?" I know some high school kids who love it and am debating whether to spend the $38.00. I have a 9yo boy, 11yo and 14yo girls. Is it hard to learn?


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
